settings.unauthorized: You are not allowed to update settings.

properties.installation_label: How do you refer to your Manifold installation?
properties.installation_instructions: 'There are various places throughout the application where Manifold refers to itself. If you set a value here, Manifold will use it where appropriate. For example, you could call it "Manifold at the University of Minnesota Press" or just "University of Minnesota Digital Books." Or, if you prefer, you can leave this blank, and Manifold will just refer to itself as "Manifold."
properties.default_title_instructions: This field will be used as the page title on the home page, and will be appended to the page title on core Manifold pages. Defaults to 'Manifold Scholarship'.
properties.default_descript_instructions: This field will be used as the page description on the home page. Defaults to 'Transforming scholarly publications into living digital works'.
properties.copyright_instructions: Enter the installation copyright information to be displayed in the footer.
properties.share_instructions: Enter the text you would like to appear when a page is shared.
properties.twitter_instructions: Enter the twitter account associated with this installation.
properties.facebook_instructions: Enter an ID for this installation/organization's Facebook page.
properties.email_instructions: If present, the footer will contain a link to a contact form that will be delivered to this address.
properties.analytics_instructions: By default, Manifold tracks anonymous usage data including visits and views. This tracking requires that a cookie be set on the user's machine. If tracking is disabled no data will be collected, and analytics views will not be visible in the backend.
properties.access_instructions: When on, users must have entitlements to access project content.
properties.access_notice_header_placeholder: Access to this project is restricted.
properties.access_notice_body_placeholder: Only users granted permission may view this project's texts, resources, and other content.
properties.library_views_instructions: When on, this setting will disable the library views on the frontend.
properties.standalone_label: Enforce Standalone Mode for All Projects
properties.standalone_instructions: When on, all projects will render in standalone mode.
properties.library_redirect_instructions: When library views are disabled, Manifold will redirect request for non-project, non-transactional pages to this URL. If left blank, these requests will return a 404 page not found error.
properties.home_redirect_instructions: If set, this URL will be used instead of the Library Page Redirect URL for requests to the Manifold home page.
properties.public_comments_instructions: When on, this setting will prevent users from commenting or annotating publicly. All reading groups will behave as private reading groups.
properties.reading_groups_instructions: When on, this setting will prevent users from creating or joining reading groups.
properties.public_reading_groups_instructions: When on, this setting will prevent users from creating public reading groups. Members of existing public reading groups will still see those groups in their reading group lists.
properties.spam_detection_instructions: Do not use Akisment for spam detection and blocking.

theme.url_instructions: If present, the footer logo will link to this URL.
theme.header_logo_instructions: The header logo appears in the top left of the frontend header. The logo will be resized to a max height of 60px.
theme.mobile_logo_instructions: This header logo will be used on mobile devices. We strongly recommend using a square logo here.
theme.footer_logo_instructions: The footer logo appears in the footer. The logo dimensions will be capped at 325px width and 200px height.
theme.favicon_instructions: The favicon will appear in the browser tab next to the page title.  The favicon will be cropped to a square, thus we strongly recommend using a square image here.
theme.logo_styles_instructions: Enter a JSON style object, which will be applied to the logo image. For example: {"left": -1}
theme.offset_instructions: Use this field to adjust the vertical position of header navigation. For example, enter "5" to move the header down 5 pixels. Enter "-5" to move it up 5 pixels.
theme.accent_color_instructions: Enter a color in one of the following formats: CSS color keyword, hexadecimal, rgb, rgba, hsl, hsla, or hwb. Leave blank to restore default accent color.
theme.foreground_color_instructions: Override the header foreground color in one of the allowed formats (see above).
theme.active_foreground_color_instructions: Override the header foreground active state color in one of the allowed formats (see above). A link in the primary navigation is "active" when the user is currently on that page.
theme.background_color_instructions: Override the header background color in one of the allowed formats (see above).
theme.color_instructions: Enter a color in one of the following formats: CSS color keyword, hexadecimal, rgb, rgba, hsl, hsla, or hwb. Leave blank to restore default accent color.

ingestion.global_styles_instructions: Styles entered here will be applied to all Texts as they are ingested.
ingestion.mammoth_style_instructions: Enter your <0>Mammoth style map</0> to convert your custom Word styles to HTML attributes.

email.from_instructions: All emails sent by manifold will be from this address.
email.name_instructions: All emails sent by manifold will appear to be sent by this name.
email.reply_instructions: Replies to emails sent by Manifold will go to this address.
email.reply_name_instructions: Replies to emails sent by Manifold will appear to be sent by this name.
email.closing_instructions: How do you want to close emails sent by Manifold?
email.smtp_address_instructions: Allows you to use a remote mail server.
email.smtp_port_instructions: On the off chance that your mail server doesn't run on port 25, you can change it.
email.smtp_user_instructions: If your mail server requires authentication, set the username in this setting.
email.smtp_password_instructions: If your mail server requires authentication, set the password in this setting.
email.sendmail_loc_instructions: The location of the sendmail executable. Defaults to /usr/sbin/sendmail.
email.sendmail_args_instructions: The command line arguments. Defaults to -i with -f sender@address added automatically before the message is sent.
